questions.text: It is characteristic of the intraglomerular capillaries that

options.text: they are fenestrated capillaries
their oncotic pressure is unusually low compared to the average capillary value
their intracapillary hydrostatic pressure is unusually high compared to the average capillary value
they are highly permeable to proteins
they are discontinuous capillaries

questions.text: What percentage of plasma urea entering the glomerular capillary is filtered in the glomeruli?

options.text: urea is not filtered

questions.text: The kidney has a role in the regulation of (M)

options.text: fluid balance
blood pressure
red cell production
electrolyte balance
pH

questions.text: The hydrostatic pressure in the efferent arteriole in the kidney is best described as being (S)

options.text: less than that in the afferent arteriole
higher than the glomerular capillary pressure
less than the peritubular capillary pressure
equal to the glomerular capillary pressure
higher than the oncotic pressure in the glomerular capillary

questions.text: The correct definition of GFR is as follows (S)

options.text: the fraction of blood flow that becomes filtrate each minute
the quantity of blood filtered through the glomerular capillaries each minute in all nephrons of both kidneys
the quantity of blood filtered in a nephron in a minute
the quantity of glomerular filtrate formed each minute in all nephrons of both kidneys

questions.text: The correct definition of filtration fraction is as follows (S)

options.text: the quantity of glomerular filtrate formed each minute
the fraction of the renal plasma flow that becomes glomerular filtrate
the fraction of glomeruli that contributes to the formation of filtrate
the fraction of the renal plasma flow that becomes urine
the fraction of cardiac output that perfuses the kidneys
the fraction of cardiac output that becomes glomerular filtrate

questions.text: The effective filtration pressure in the glomeruli is calculated as follows: (S)

options.text: capsular pressure + glomerular pressure – colloid osmotic pressure
colloid osmotic pressure + capsular pressure – glomerular pressure
glomerular pressure – capsular pressure – colloid osmotic pressure
colloid osmotic pressure + glomerular pressure – capsular pressure
colloid osmotic pressure – glomerular pressure – capsular pressure

questions.text: It is characteristic of the intraglomerular capillaries that

options.text: their oncotic pressure is unusually low
they are discontinuous capillaries
their intracapillary pressure is unusually high
they are fenestrated capillaries
they are highly permeable to proteins

questions.text: The effective filtration pressure in the glomeruli is calculated as follows:

options.text: colloid osmotic P + capsular P - glomerular P
glomerular P - capsular P - colloid osmotic P
colloid osmotic P - glomerular P - capsular P
colloid osmotic P + glomerular P - capsular P
capsular P + glomerular P - colloid osmotic P

questions.text: The correct definition of GFR is as follows

options.text: the fraction of the blood flow that becomes filtrate each min
the quantity of blood filtered through the glomerular capillaries each minute in all nephrons of both kidneys
the quantity of blood filtered in a nephron in a minute
the quantity of glomerular filtrate formed each minute in all nephrons of both kidneys

questions.text: Which filtration layer has the lowest permeability in the glomerulus?

options.text: basal membrane
external cells of the Bowman capsule
endothelial cells
podocytes

questions.text: What percentage of plasma glucose entering the glomerular capillaries is filtered into the glomeruli?

options.text: glucose is not filtered

questions.text: Which filtration layer has the lowest permeability in the glomerulus?

options.text: basal membrane
external cells of the Bowman capsule
endothelial cells
podocytes

questions.text: What percentage of plasma glucose entering the glomerular capillary is filtered in the glomeruli?

options.text: glucose is not filtered

questions.text: The correct definition of filtration fraction is as follows

options.text: the fraction of the total plasma flow that becomes glomerular filtrate
the fraction of cardiac output that becomes glomerular filtrate
the fraction of glomeruli that contributes to the formation of filtrate
the fraction of the renal plasma flow that becomes urine
the fraction of cardiac output that perfuses the kidneys
the quantity of glomerular filtrate formed each min

questions.text: Which of the following values are within the normal range?

options.text: PAH clearance - 120 ml / min
filtration fraction - 0.50
RBF - 1300 ml/min
RPF - 660 ml / min
GFR - 120 ml / min
rate is directly proportional to systemic arterial pressure
has the same composition as lymph
has the same composition as plasma in the efferent arterioles
rate increases when the RPF decreases
rate (GFR) increases when the NaCl concentration of the distal tubules decreases
